title: Israel: Biden still concerned about judicial overhaul as he invites Netanyahu to US
description: President Joe Biden invited Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to the United States for a meeting, the first since the latter returned to office late last year. The invitation comes at a time when Washington continues to express disapproval over the Israeli government's controversial legal reforms.

title: Macron keeps Borne as prime minister, will address the nation this week
description: A government reschuffle is expected in the coming days and the Elysée said Macron will speak before the end of the week, 100 days after the enactment of his contested pension reform.

title: Are the Olympics to blame for the lack of accommodation for the homeless around Paris?
description: The decline in the number of hotels offering emergency accommodation and the creation of regional 'SAS' reception centers, both attributed to the summer 2024 sporting event, can be explained in a number of different ways.

title: Wildfires break out near Athens forcing evacuation of seaside resorts
description: 1,200 children have been evacuated from Greek holiday camps threatened by the wildfires.

title: EU competition chief set for grilling by MEPs over top job for American
description: Margrethe Vestager will be questioned on Tuesday over hiring US former lobbyist Fiona Scott Morton in a very senior and strategic EU post.

title: War in Ukraine: The foreign soldiers fighting in the name of internationalism
description: A mural in Odesa pays tribute to three anarchist fighters of American, Russian and Irish nationality, who were killed on April 19 on the Bakhmut front line.

title: Hagai El-Ad, the disillusioned prophet who denounced Israel's 'apartheid regime'
description: After nine years at the head of the Israeli organization B'Tselem, the activist is handing over the reins, aware of the limits of what he can do in defense of Palestine.

title: Fiona Scott Morton 'is a Trojan horse for Big Tech' at the European Commission
description: In an interview with Le Monde, Matt Stoller talks about the reticence, even opposition, after the European Commission announced the recruitment of the former US lobbyist as chief economist in the Competition Directorate-General.

title: From Paris to Marseille, France's cities are facing creeping gentrification
description: Soaring property prices, proactive urban renewal policies and 'Airbnbization': Across Europe, urban areas are undergoing profound changes, risking uniformity and the exclusion of certain parts of the population.

title: 'Banh mi is the product of cultural mixing and colonization'
description: 'A world of street food' (1/6). In Paris, Khanh-Ly Huynh offers tasty Vietnamese sandwiches made with a white baguette and brimming with fillings.

title: Russia halts wartime Black Sea grain deal, putting global food security at risk
description: A Kremlin spokesperson said Moscow would return the Black Sea grain deal, vital for Ukrainian ports to export grains and other food to the world, if its demands were met.

title: Immigration: EU's Von der Leyen secures agreement with Tunisia
description: Promised since June 11, the text provides for better control of migrants embarking for Europe, as well as the readmission of undocumented Tunisians.

title: Airbus struggles to keep up with bursting order book
description: The European aircraft manufacturer inaugurated a new final assembly line in Toulouse on Monday. It will enable the company to produce up to 75 single-aisle aircraft a month.

title: South Korea death toll from extreme flooding climbs to at least 40
description: Rescuers in South Korea have recovered a total of 13 bodies from a flooded road tunnel in a central South Korean city, as the death toll from flash floods and landslides  rose to at least 40.

title: Climate change: Is France prepared for more forest fires?
description: The risk of France's forests going up in smoke is increasing throughout the country. Shocked by the severity of the fires in the summer of 2022, which acted as a wake-up call, officials are trying to be better prepared.

title: Traffic on Russia-built Crimea bridge halted after 'emergency', says Moscow authorities
description: The health ministry in Russia's Krasnodar region, which lies at the eastern end of the bridge, said two people were killed in an unspecified accident on the bridge and their daughter was injured.

title: Gérard Depardieu and the twilight of a sacred monster of French cinema
description: The Depardieu case 1|6. Le Monde investigated the famed actor's past and personality. His behavior toward women, long tolerated by the film world, has now earned him serious accusations and further isolated him. His films have become sparse, and some of his stage shows have been canceled.

title: Photojournalist Marie-Laure de Decker has died
description: She became a journalist during the Vietnam War, and traveled the length and breadth of the African continent, from Chad to South Africa. She was also involved with fashion and cinema. She died on July 15 at the age of 75.

title: The Neanderthal biface, the Swiss Army knife of France's first inhabitants
description: 'An underground history of France' (1/12). In Saint-Amand-les-Eaux, in 2007, a Neanderthal site was unearthed, probably a butchery, with flints that were carved, sharpened – and some, aesthetically pleasing. The surprising discovery broke with our brutish conception of the Neanderthals.

title: Jane Birkin: 'Serge Gainsbourg was a provocateur with a wildly romantic soul'
description: In 2013, Jane Birkin, who died on Sunday, spoke with Le Monde about singer Serge Gainsbourg, who was her partner and wrote many songs for her.

title: Heavy rains in US Northeast: At least 5 dead in Pennsylvania
description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul urged people to stay home Sunday until the storms passed.
